advantages.name: 2 - Choose 30 points in Advantages from the following list:

children.notes: A teacher or fellow student, or other practitioners generally

features.situation: from members of your religion and those who respect your faith

children.name: Cultural Familiarity (Choose a culture)
children.notes: Do not suffer the normal -3 penalty for unfamiliarity

children.name: Indomitable
children.notes: Impossible to influence through ordinary words or actions

children.name: Less Sleep
children.notes: Require 1 hour/level less sleep for a full night's rest (max 4)

children.name: Longevity
children.notes: You fail aging rolls only on a 17 or 18, or only on an 18 if your modified HT is 17 or better

modifiers.name: Specialized
modifiers.notes: @Type: Angels, Demons, Elementals, Faerie, Ghosts, etc.@

advantages.name: 6 - Choose -25 points in Disadvantages from the following list:

children.name: Absent-Mindedness

features.situation: to all IQ and IQ-based skill rolls, save those for the task you are currently concentrating on

children.notes: Once adrift in your own thoughts, you must roll against Perception-5 in order to notice any event short of personal physical injury

children.name: Charitable
children.notes: Make a self-control roll in any situation where you could render aid or are specifically asked for help, but should resist the urge

children.name: Curious
children.notes: Make a self-control roll when presented with an interesting item or situation

children.name: Nightmares
children.notes: Make a self-control roll each morning upon awakening. If you fail, you suffered nightmares; this costs you 1 FP that you can only recover through sleep. On a roll of 17 or 18, you are left shaking, and are at -1 to all skill and Perception rolls for the entire day.

children.name: Truthfulness
children.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you must keep silent about an uncomfortable truth (lying by omission). Roll at -5 if you actually have to tell a falsehood! If you fail, you blurt out the truth, or stumble so much that your lie is obvious.

children.name: Vow (Choose a Minor, Major or Great Vow) [varies]

skills.name: 9 - Choose one Skill from the following list:
10 - Choose one Skill from the following list:

notes.text: Forget about spells and instead take abilities based on advantages, with modifiers that make them look “magical” – and call them “spells.” In principle, just about any power could be defined as magical, and any template with superpowers could be called a “magician” by changing the Super modifier to the Magical modifier. But classic comic-book mages often have fairly specific abilities.
The mystic is built to fit that pattern. Point cost for the mystic is 500.
